availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew Jackson James (Frankfort attorney and Attorney General of Kentucky)

body.p: Frankfort attorney and Attorney General of Kentucky. Pulaski County native. Married Marry A. Beatie James in 1841. Father of John James, Daniel James, Clara James, Samuel James, and Emma James. Pulaski County Representative in 1855. Attorney General of Kentucky from 1859 to 1863. Held ten slaves in 1860.

Lewis, 1881), p. 10. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pulaski County, Somerset, p. 1.
